summary: This is an internal email chain from July 2019 among investigators summarizing interviews conducted with victims and witnesses following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest. It details multiple allegations of sexual abuse and exploitation, describes Epstein's massage operation involving minors, and mentions a fraudulent marriage scheme.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of sexually abusing multiple victims, operating a massage scheme involving young girls, and orchestrating a fraudulent marriage.

persons.name: Russel
persons.context: Person to whom the interview summaries are to be sent, likely a supervisor or senior official ('brass').

connections.description: Epstein is described as sexually abusing multiple young women and girls during massages and other encounters.
The assistant worked for Epstein from early 2005 to early 2006, scheduling his daily massages and running errands.

connections.person2: Unnamed victim (interviewed July 17, 2019 in New York)
connections.description: Epstein had sexual encounters with this victim from 2007-2009, paid her $10,000 to enter a fraudulent marriage in 2013, and she occasionally worked for him.

events.title: Victim Interviews in Florida
events.description: Two victims were interviewed in Florida. One described abuse at age 14 in 2002, and the other described abuse at age 16 or 17 in the early 2000s.

events.title: Assistant and Victim Interviews
events.description: Interviews conducted in New York and Florida, including with a former Epstein assistant who detailed his massage operation and scheduling of young girls.

events.title: Additional Victim Interviews
events.description: Interviews in Florida and New York, including with a victim who described a long-term relationship with Epstein from 2007-2017, including a fraudulent marriage he arranged.

events.title: Epstein's Assistant Employment Period
events.description: A former assistant worked for Epstein, scheduling his daily massages and becoming aware that the massages were sexual and involved young, likely minor, girls.

events.title: Long-term Victim Relationship and Fraudulent Marriage
events.description: A victim known to Epstein from age 17 described sexual encounters, a trip to his private island, and being paid $10,000 in 2013 to marry someone so they could stay in the U.S.

locations: Private island in the Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Epstein expected two massages per day: one in the morning and one in the afternoon, which were scheduled by his assistant.
Epstein's massage operation involved two distinct groups: professional masseuses for his friends, and young, non-professional girls (often minors) who only massaged him.
A victim was paid $10,000 by Epstein in or around 2013 to enter a fraudulent marriage with another individual to help that person stay in the United States.
The investigative team had conducted at least seven interviews with victims and witnesses in Florida and New York in the week following Epstein's arrest.
Multiple victims described never having been interviewed by law enforcement or the press prior to these 2019 interviews.
